lead_paragraph: DRAPKIN--Donald Guy. 67 years, of Aspen, CO and New York City, passed away peacefully on February 22, 2016, surrounded by his loved ones, following a brain injury sustained in Aspen during Presidents' Weekend. Don spent his last day doing one of the things he loved best; skiing in Aspen, where he and his partner Sue Hostetler had lived for the past two years. Don was born on March 1, 1948, and was raised in Queens, NY, and later received a B.A. from Brandeis University in 1968, followed by a J.D. from Columbia University School of Law. Don was founder and Chairman of Casablanca Capital. Most recently, he was Vice Chairman of Lazard International and Chairman of Lazard's Investment Committee and Chairman and CEO of Sapphire Industrials, an $800 million Lazard sponsored SPAC. Prior to joining Lazard in 2007, Don was Vice Chairman and Director of MacAndrews & Forbes Holdings Inc. and held similar positions with various affiliates from 1987 to 2007. From 1977 to 1987, he was a partner in the New York law firm of Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP. He began his career as an attorney with the firm of Cravath, Swaine & Moore from 1971 to 1977 and was a member of the American Bar Association and the New York City Bar Association. Over the course of his 40 year career, Don had been an advisor and a principal in significant securities transactions and business combinations. He was a frequent guest on CNBC, and a panelist at other financial events. Until his death, Don served on the Board of Directors of Tanger Factory Outlet Centers and had previously served on the boards of several other public companies, including: Anthracite Capital Inc., Marvel Holdings Inc., The Molson Companies Limited, Nephros Inc., Playboy Enterprises, Revlon Inc. and SIGA Technologies, among others. Don was also a generous philanthropist, serving on the following boards: New York Special Olympics Annual Metro Tournaments, for which he served as Co-Chairman; Law Enforcement Foundation, Inc.; Jewish Community Center; Brandeis University (Emeritas Member after having served for the twenty-five years); American Lawyer Media, Inc.; the Board of Overseers to the Lemberg Program of Brandeis University; as a Member of Development, Program and Nominating Committees of the Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars; and, Hope and Heroes Children's Cancer Fund Advisory Board. At the time of his death, he served on the Board of Directors of Lincoln Center Theater, the Aspen Music Festival and School, Theater Aspen, the Federal Enforcement Homeland Security Foundation, Inc.; was a member of the Dean's Council of Columbia Law School; and served as a National Council member of the Anderson Ranch in Aspen/ Snowmass, CO. A huge lover of life, with a twinkle in his eye, and a wry smile that could light up any room, Don was much loved by many. Don was a rare individual who had scores of friends going back four and five decades. Don loved to ski and cycle and was a lifelong theater lover. Don and Sue also enjoyed collecting art together, regularly visiting galleries and art fairs around the world. In addition to Sue, Don is survived by his wife Bernice from whom he had been separated; his son Matthew Drapkin and his wife Annie Drapkin; his daughter Dana Drapkin Baumgarten and her husband Joshua Baumgarten; his daughter Nicole Drapkin Schaffer and her husband Marc Schaffer; his son David Drapkin; and his daughter Amanda Drapkin; adoring grandchildren William, Annabel, Charles and Elizabeth Drapkin; and Lilly, Emma and Georgia Baumgarten; and Sue's daughter Spencer Diamond. Don was preceded in death by his cherished son Dustin; and his parents George and Mildred (Kaufman) Drapkin. The funeral will be held at 11am, today, Thursday, February 25 at Temple Sinai of Bergen County, 1 Engle Street, Tenafly, NJ 07670. Details of the Celebration of Life to be held in Aspen next week will be forthcoming. In lieu of flowers, please consider a donation to the Aspen Music Festival and School (Kat Berg kberg@aspenmusic.org 970-205-5061) or Lincoln Center Theater (Hattie Jutagir jutagir@lct.org 212-501-3250). 1/3
